intro: Eriocaulon laosense var. maxwellii, commonly known as the Laos mountain sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges, rushes, and similar plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, clustered inflorescences. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as mountain forests and wetlands. Its botanical features make it an important component of the local flora and ecosystem.
